discussion.content:
Add a new user to secondary group using useradd

You need to the useradd command to add new users to existing group (or create a new group and then add user). If group does not exist, create it. The syntax is as follows:
useradd -G {group-name} username

Selected Answer: A
Definitely A. You're appending on a new group to the user, which is where the -a comes in.

https://linux.die.net/man/8/usermod

Not C. C will change their initial login group. But that's not what you're trying to do, you're just trying to add a user to a group.

https://linux.die.net/man/8/useradd

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
